{{also|butter}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|buter}}, {{m|gmh|butter}} {{g|m}}, {{g|f}}, from {{inh|de|goh|butera}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*buterǭ}}, borrowed from {{der|de|la|butyra}}, collective plural of {{m|la|butyrum}}. Though originally feminine, the word became masculine throughout [[Upper German]] and in southern dialects of [[West Central German]]. The now established feminine gender is [[East Central German]], reinforced by {{der|de|gml|boter}} {{g|f}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈbʊtɐ/}} * {{audio|de|De-Butter.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f|g2=m||-}} # [[butter]] #: {{syn|de|Anke|q=Switzerland}} ====Usage notes==== * In the formal standard language, {{m|de|Butter}} is exclusively feminine.
